intro: Scrophularia denaensis, commonly known as the Dena dogbane, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Turkey. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae, which includes many species with showy flowers and often medicinal properties. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its flowers are usually pale purple to white, with five petals and a distinctive tubular structure. Scrophularia denaensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been the subject of botanical studies due to its unique ecological niche.
